concept.title: Example: Restrict the content model for the topic element using RNG
concept.shortdesc: In this scenario, a DITA architect for Acme, Incorporated wants to redefine the content model for the topic document type. They want to omit the abstract element and make the shortdesc element required; they also want to omit the related-links element and disallow topic nesting.

ol.li: The DITA architect creates a constraint module: acme-TopicConstraintMod.rng.
They update the catalog.xml file to include the new constraint module.

They add the following content to acme-TopicConstraint.mod:
CONTENT MODEL OVERRIDES
I know that the override won't happen without combine="interleave", but I don't know if we cover that in the coding requirements topic. If people start with copying-and-pasting from the module that they are overriding, they won't have that and will get errors.

They then integrate the constraint module into the document-type shell for topic by adding an include element in the "ELEMENT-TYPE CONFIGURATION INTEGRATION" section:
ELEMENT-TYPE CONFIGURATION INTEGRATION

li.p: They then remove the include statement that references topicMod.rng from the "MODULE INCLUSIONS" section:

ol.li: They check their test topic to ensure that the content model is modified as expected.
